ifcDoor.description: A door is a construction for closing an opening in a wall or partition.

ifcWindow.description: A window is a construction for closing an opening in a wall or roof, primarily to admit light and provide ventilation.

ifcWall.description: A wall is a vertical construction that bounds or subdivides a building.

ifcFurniture.description: Furniture refers to movable objects intended to support various human activities.

ifcLightFixture.description: A light fixture is a device that holds and protects the light bulb and is used to direct the light.

ifcAirTerminal.description: An air terminal is a device that controls the flow of air in a duct system.

ifcComputer.description: A computer is a programmable electronic device that processes data.

ifcSwitchingDevice.description: A switching device is a device that controls the flow of electricity in a circuit.

ifcSensor.description: A sensor is a device that detects and responds to some type of input from the physical environment.

ifcAudioVisualAppliance.description: An audio visual appliance is a device that processes or displays audio or video signals.

ifcElectricalOutlet.description: An electrical outlet is a device that allows for the connection of electrical devices to a power source.

ifcSanitaryTerminal.description: A sanitary terminal is a fixed appliance that receives water and/or waste water.

ifcEquipmentElement.description: An equipment element is a fixed mechanical device that performs a specific function.

ifcFurnishingElement.description: A furnishing element is a movable or fixed object that contributes to the equipment of a building.

ifcDuctSegment.description: A duct segment is a linear element that forms part of a duct system.

ifcController.description: A controller is a device that manages and controls other devices or systems.

ifcSign.description: A sign is a device that conveys information or instructions.
